column4: when im booting livecd ubuntu 8.04 ,, i am using a s-video out to tv to see it, i see everything uptil when i say run ubuntu without any changes, and then the progress bar fills up and theres a black screen forever until i restart
please advise
BIOSTAR VP5200SL16 GeForce FX 5200 128MB 64-bit DDR AGP 4X/8X Low Profile Ready Video Card
geforce fx 5200 agp
huh?!
so what should i do
i have a geforce fx 5500
with svideo out as well
That card should work fine with the close-source nvidia driver installed.
thats nice but i need to install ubuntu first
Can you flip to console (alt-F1) ?
i havent tried, but i bet it would work, because i can defintlye see output on the tv from bootup (bios post etc)
Yeah, it lacks that driver.
will ubuntu 8.10 support it
... so it defaults to vesa.
based on what snuxoll says, I wouldn't count on it.
it will, use the alternate cd - which can run in text mode.
ok so thats another download i gotta do?
Yup... and you really don't have any guarantee that it'll work :-(
no commercial reason for them to
Drop support, force upgrades, increase sales, limit development requirements...
